## Analysis

Looking at my hand levels, my Two Pair is Level 6 (120 chips, 7 mult) and has been played 14 times - this is my most leveled hand. Flush is Level 2 (50 chips, 6 mult) and has been played 5 times.

My recent plays show I've been relying heavily on Flush plays, scoring between 11,000-15,000 chips per hand in Ante 5.

Key observations:
1. Ancient Joker now gives X1.5 mult per HEART (changed from Spade at end of round)


2. Since Smeared Joker converts Hearts to Diamonds, those Diamonds also trigger Ancient Joker's multiplier
3. With $36 available, I can afford several shop items

For Ante 6, the blind requirements will roughly double. My Flush strategy has been performing well with the Ancient Joker and Smeared Joker synergy, whereas Two Pair scales better additively than multiplicatively. I'm considering whether to upgrade Two Pair with Uranus or invest in boosters to strengthen my hand composition.

The main options are Gluttonous Joker for Club scaling (though I'd need to sell a joker first since I'm at capacity), Jumbo Celestial Pack to level up Flush or other hands, Spectral Pack for unpredictable effects, or Reroll to search for better offerings. Since Flush remains my strongest scoring engine and I need to prepare for significantly tougher blinds ahead, I should prioritize options that amplify my existing synergies rather than dilute my strategy.

The Jumbo Celestial Pack seems most reliable—it guarantees a planet card from five options, likely including one that boosts Flush. This would push Flush to Level 3 with improved base values. With $30 left after spending $6, I could still grab Uranus to support Two Pair as a secondary hand, or preserve capital for future shops. Though there's some variance in which planet I receive, the consistency of getting a hand-leveling card outweighs the risk compared to Spectral Pack's unpredictability. I need to evaluate what would help most right now. Ancient Joker's multiplicative scaling with suited cards is powerful—a 5-card Flush in the target suit would hit (1.5)^5 = 7.59375x multiplier. The Jumbo Celestial Pack lets me choose from 5 planet cards to level up whichever hand type I'm weakest in, which should be Flush. That direct improvement to my scoring potential makes it the clear choice over the reroll.

## My Jokers
1. Odd Todd - +31 chips per odd card (A, 9, 7, 5, 3)
2. Ancient Joker - X1.5 mult per Heart (currently)
3. Swashbuckler - +11 mult
4. Even Steven - +4 mult per even card

## Planet Card Options
1. Neptune - Level up Straight Flush +4 Mult and +40 chips (currently Level 2: 140 chips, 12 mult)
2. Pluto - Level up High Card +1 Mult and +10 chips (currently Level 1: 5 chips, 1 mult)
3. Earth - Level up Full House +2 Mult and +25 chips (currently Level 2: 65 chips, 6 mult)
4. Saturn - Level up Straight +3 Mult and +30 chips (currently Level 1: 30 chips, 4 mult)

## Analysis

Looking at my hand history, I've been heavily relying on Flush (played 5 times) and Two Pair (played 14 times). My most recent plays show Flush scoring between 11,000-15,000 chips in Ante 5.

The key synergy in my deck is:
- Ancient Joker gives X1.5 mult per suited card (currently Hearts)
- Smeared Joker makes Hearts=Diamonds, so all Hearts/Diamonds trigger Ancient Joker


- A full 5-card Flush in the right suit multiplies to (1.5)^5 = 7.59x multiplier

Flush is my primary scoring engine and currently at Level 2 with 50 chips and 6 mult. Since Ancient Joker rotates suits each round and Smeared Joker lets me combine two suits, I can consistently build strong Flush hands. With Ante 6 requiring significantly higher scores, upgrading Flush to Level 3 via Jupiter would add crucial scaling to my most reliable hand.

The alternatives don't compare—Neptune, Pluto, and Earth are played infrequently and lack consistency, while Saturn only appears 4 times and isn't central to my strategy. Jupiter's +15 chips and +2 mult directly strengthen my core engine, pushing Flush to 65 chips and 8 mult, which compounds effectively with Ancient Joker's multiplicative bonus.

Cards:

Current Reroll Cost: $5

## Analysis

My primary strategy has been Flush plays with Ancient Joker multiplicative scaling. I just upgraded Flush to Level 3 (65 chips, 8 mult), which should help significantly.

With $30, I have several options:

1. **Buy Uranus ($3)** - This would level up Two Pair to Level 7 (140 chips, 8 mult). Two Pair has been my secondary hand and is already at Level 6. This is a cheap upgrade that maintains flexibility.

2. **Buy Gluttonous Joker ($5)** - But I'm at capacity, so I'd need to sell a joker first. This gives +3 mult per Club. With Smeared Joker, Clubs count as Spades. This doesn't synergize as well with Ancient Joker (currently Heart-focused).
   
The Spectral Pack offers unpredictable but potentially powerful effects, while Reroll Surplus would let me explore more options—I could reroll 6 times with the remaining $20 instead of just 4. Alternatively, I could spend $5 on a single reroll to see what else becomes available. Since Ante 6 will bring significantly tougher blinds, I need to decide whether to strengthen my current Flush-Ancient Joker engine or invest in flexibility through rerolls. Rerolling now would cost $5 and leave me with $25, but I'm not confident it would turn up anything better than what Uranus offers. Buying Uranus is the clear choice—it's an affordable upgrade to a hand I've relied on, and I'll still have solid capital for future shops.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.
